description: Steven Seagal, an American actor known for his roles in action films, has become a Serbian citizen, state television in the European country announced on Monday
title: Steven Seagal granted Serbian citizenship
title_page: Steven Seagal granted Serbian citizenship | Daily Mail Online
text:
American actor Steven Seagal has won Serbian citizenship
American action hero Steven Seagal has become a Serbian citizen.
The decision to grant Seagal citizenship was announced on Serbian state television on Monday after the veteran actor, producer, and martial artist made two recent visits to the country.
Seagal has praised Serbia's populist leadership and said he feels like a Serb.
During one visit, Seagal was offered to train Serbian special police forces in Aikido, a Japanese martial art that Seagal has practiced since he was a teenager.
His visits to Serbia were sponsored by a pro-Russian Serb group.
The 63-year-old actor debuted in the 1988 action film Above The Law and went on to star in several successful movies in the 1990s.
From 2001 until 2010, when he returned to the big screen in Robert Rodriguez's Machete, Seagal appeared in direct-to-video films.
Seagal is thought to be an acquaintance of Vladimir Putin and has been seen alongside the Russian leader on several occasions.
In this file photo, Russian leader Vladimir Putin shakes the hand of American actor Steven Seagal, who was granted Serbian citizenship on Monday
Steven Seagal signs autographs in Moscow after receiving a star at the Moscow Alley of Glory in September 2015
The two share a love for marital arts, and seem to have some agreement on policy, as well.
Seagal told the Russian state-run newspaper Rossiskaya Gazeta in March 2014 that he thinks Russia's annexation of Crimea from Ukraine was 'very reasonable,' according to the Moscow Times.
He went on to say that he considered Putin his 'brother,' and that he considered seeking Russian citizenship.
Serbia is a candidate for European Union membership but has faced opposition from pro-Kremlin nationalists.
